name: Add date of birth field in user registration page
description: Add date of birth field in user registration page
llmTaskExplanation: Add a 'date of birth' field to the user registration page. This involves updating the user registration form to include a new input field for the date of birth, ensuring it is properly validated and stored in the database.
validations: The date of birth field should accept valid date formats (e.g., YYYY-MM-DD).
The date of birth should not be a future date.
The user should be at least 18 years old.
The date of birth field should be required.
unitTests: Test that the date of birth field accepts a valid date format.
Test that the date of birth field rejects future dates.
Test that the date of birth field rejects dates indicating the user is under 18.
Test that the date of birth field is required and shows an error if left empty.
acceptanceCriteria: Given a user registration form, when the user enters a valid date of birth, then the form should accept the input.
Given a user registration form, when the user enters a future date, then the form should display an error message.
Given a user registration form, when the user enters a date indicating they are under 18, then the form should display an error message.
Given a user registration form, when the user submits the form without a date of birth, then the form should display an error message.
technicalDependencies: Date validation library (e.g., moment.js or date-fns) if not already in use.
security: Ensure the date of birth input is sanitized to prevent injection attacks.
Handle the date of birth as PII and ensure it is stored securely.
performance: Ensure the addition of the date of birth field does not significantly impact form load times.
businessContext: The date of birth is required to ensure users meet age requirements for registration.
otherNotes: Consider adding a feature flag if this change needs to be rolled out gradually.

llmAssumptions.assumption: The tech stack includes a frontend framework like React or Angular.
The backend is capable of handling date inputs and storing them in the database.
There is an existing user registration form to modify.
